hedline.hl2: The Residences at Atlantis and the Ritz-Carlton, Rancho Mirage

abstract.p: Breaking Ground column describes Residences at Atlantis, condominium-hotel on Paradise Island, Bahamas, and Residences at the Ritz-Carlton, Rancho Mirage, hotel and residences in Rancho Mirage, Calif; drawings (M)

block.p: WHAT -- Condominium-hotel at a large resort. WHERE -- Paradise Island in the Bahamas. AMENITIES -- Beach access, a swimming pool and a restaurant, among others. PRICES -- $700,000 to more than $3.5 million. STATUS -- Expected to open in December. DEVELOPER -- Turnberry Ltd. CONTACT -- (800) 940-2006 or www.theresidencesatatlantis.com. DETAILS -- This project is part of the third phase of development at Atlantis, a 171-acre, nearly 3,000-room resort on an island connected by a bridge to Nassau, the capital of the Bahamas. A 22-story building just off the beach, it will have 495 units, from studios to two-bedroom suites, that owners may enter in a revenue-sharing rental program. There will be a private lounge for owners, along with the swimming pool and restaurant at the residential building. Another new addition to the resort is a 600-suite hotel, the Cove, that opened last week and offers restaurants, including one by Bobby Flay. The resort's amenities includes a water park, a marine habitat, a casino, a full-service spa and restaurants by Nobu Matsuhisa and Jean-Georges Vongerichten. There are nonstop flights to Nassau from several major American cities, including New York.
The Residences at the Ritz-Carlton, Rancho Mirage

WHAT -- Hotel and residences in a resort area. WHERE -- Rancho Mirage, Calif. AMENITIES -- A full-service spa and swimming pools, among others. PRICES -- Various residences start at $895,000. STATUS -- The hotel will open in December, with residences following in May 2008. DEVELOPER -- Gencom Group. CONTACT -- (888) 972-6240 or www.livingranchomirage.com. DETAILS -- On 40 acres near Palm Springs, Calif., this project will overlook the Coachella Valley from a plateau. It comprises a 244-room Ritz-Carlton hotel and 150 residences in three types: 18 studio to two-bedroom condos attached to the spa, 58 one- to three-bedroom condos in a private wing of the hotel building, and 74 two- to four-bedroom stand-alone, two-story villas. A rental program will be available. All the residences will include balconies or terraces, and many will feature plunge pools, fire pits and outdoor showers. There will be a residents-only swimming pool, and residents will also have access to all the hotel's amenities, which include more pools and two restaurants. A concierge will book golf and tennis at the area's many clubs. The Palm Springs airport has flights from Los Angeles, Seattle, Denver and Houston, among other cities.
